body_html:
@nicklhy Check out nonechucks - it's a library for PyTorch that allows you to do exactly that (and more)!

You can convert an ImageFolder containing damanged image files into a SafeDataset, which automatically skips such images for you without you having to write any extra code. It acts as a wrapper around your existing dataset.

The resulting code would look something like this.

import nonechucks as nc

dataset = ImageFolder('...')
dataset = nc.SafeDataset(dataset)
body_text:
@nicklhy Check out nonechucks - it's a library for PyTorch that allows you to do exactly that (and more)!
You can convert an ImageFolder containing damanged image files into a SafeDataset, which automatically skips such images for you without you having to write any extra code. It acts as a wrapper around your existing dataset.
The resulting code would look something like this.
import nonechucks as nc

dataset = ImageFolder('...')
dataset = nc.SafeDataset(dataset)
body:
@nicklhy Check out [nonechucks](https://github.com/msamogh/nonechucks) - it's a library for PyTorch that allows you to do exactly that (and more)!

You can convert an `ImageFolder` containing damanged image files into a `SafeDataset`, which automatically skips such images for you without you having to write any extra code. It acts as a wrapper around your existing dataset.

The resulting code would look something like this.
```python
import nonechucks as nc

dataset = ImageFolder('...')
dataset = nc.SafeDataset(dataset)
```
